page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: Handsworth and Woodhouse are suburbs of the large city of Sheffield and have a close community atmosphere. Woodhouse is an old village where the old stocks and a cross still stand.There are large new housing estates on the outskirts built to accommodate workers in the city. Handsworth is now more industrialised than Woodhouse but it also was originally an old village. There is a large industrial estate with various types of factories, warehouses and offices and also Orgreave Coking Plant which was prominent in the news in 1985. There are some ancient sites including Handsworth Parish Church which dates back to . The Cross Keys is the only public house in England to be sited in a graveyard and it has an old escape tunnel underneath it.
